RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 57. Maiden Claiming Purse 18700. FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SIR MASON broke alertly to clear the field quickly, opened a decisive advantage through the turn and held well down the lane while weakening late. KOLTEN'S PRIDE reserved off the early pace for the first three-eighths, saved ground on the bend cutting the corner coming home and rallied well down the lane. SPIRIT OF SEATTLE unhurried early to trail, circled five wide on the turn while steadily advancing and finished willingly just being denied the place. INCITATUSWAY stalked the pace to the turn, made a mild bid turning for home and flattened out down the lane. DESTINO was never a threat. STANDINGINTHEFIRE chased the pacesetter to the turn and gave way.

ENTRY.NAME: Sir Mason
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke alertly, quickly cleared, widened, held on

ENTRY.NAME: Incitatusway
ENTRY.OWNER: Mark Yagour Inc and Marcus Yagour LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, early bid, flattened out,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 2 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 76. Claiming Purse 15400. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 125 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 27 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: J P'S GLADYS stalked the pace through the turn, rallied from four wide turning for home and wore the pacesetter down in the final strides. VACATION SECRET set the pace from the onset, opened a clear lead in the turn, maintained that advantage to mid-stretch, responded well but was unable to hold off the winner in deep stretch in a game effort. SPLASH OF TONIC prompted the pace through the turn, saved ground turning for home and kept on through the lane unable to gain on the leaders. OUT ATTHE SPEEDWAY tracked the leaders to upper stretch and finished willingly to narrow the margin late in the lane. MITESSE chased the pace from the fence into the turn, lost position in the bend and passed weaker rivals in the stretch. CAGUA unhurried in the early going, rallied mildly on the bend and flattened out in the lane. SECRET SEDUCTION never posed a threat.

ENTRY.NAME: Cagua
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, rally turn, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: Mitesse
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside, dropped back, passed tiring rivals,

ENTRY.NAME: Splash of Tonic
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted pace, saved ground, kept on

ENTRY.NAME: J P's Gladys
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, rally 4w, wore rival down, prevailed late

ENTRY.NAME: Vacation Secret
ENTRY.COMMENT: clear lead, responded, gamely, caught late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 3 1M Dirt CR: 77. Claiming Purse 10900. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE DECEMBER 27. Three Year Olds, 125 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HE'S A SHOOTER took command leaving the gate, opened a clear advantage in the first turn, controlled the tempo down the backside, widened turning for home and was never challenged in a dominant performance. BOBBY'S GIFT tracked the leader from three wide down the backside, mounted a bid in the turn, was no match for the winner but finished willingly to hold the place. GUARD prompted the early pace, remained in striking distance to the head of the lane and kept on through the lane to maintain his position. AMERICAN NIGHTMARE mounted an early bid down the backside to attempt to engage the leader, dropped back on the bend while saving ground having been unable to sustain his bid and finished evenly. EXALTED JOY passed tiring rivals down the stretch. JACK'S ADVANTAGE went one-paced failing to menace. DUEL FUEL trailed most of the way and passed weaker rivals late. DEER CREEK ROAD never threatened. BIG FALCON ROCKET contended early and faded coming home.

ENTRY.NAME: American Nightmare
ENTRY.COMMENT: early bid, saved ground, evenly late

ENTRY.NAME: Bobby's Gift
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3 wide, steady advance, no match, held place

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 4 1M Dirt CR: 86. Claiming Purse 17600. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 125 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 27 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000 (Races Where Entered For $7,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAUREENLOVESFRANK raced well off the rail while taking command from the gate, remained in the five path while being well rationed on the front end, opened a clear lead in the final turn and maintained that advantage to the wire in a well handled ride. SPECIAL BEACH stalked the pace through the final turn, rallied turning for home, could not gain on the winner while finishing well to be second best. ONE NIGHT STAND reserved off the early pace, rallied up the fence saving all the ground in the turn and finished evenly to hold the show. SASSY JUSTICE unhurried early on and made a grinding rally in the turn to improve his position. ANNMARIA tracked the pacesetter to upper stretch and failed to mount a closing bid. ANIPPE pressed the pace for three quarters of a mile and weakened in the stretch. GO STELLAIRE passed tiring rivals late. BACKSPLASH was never a threat. DESIGNATE was not a factor. ACCOLADES GALORE dropped back through the final bend, was eased in mid-stretch and walked off.

ENTRY.NAME: One Night Stand
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved, inside bid turn, kept on

ENTRY.NAME: Maureenlovesfrank
ENTRY.COMMENT: raced wide, well rationed, controlled, clear lead,

ENTRY.NAME: Special Beach
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, bid, not ehough, 2d best

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 5 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 62. Claiming Purse 12100. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 125 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 27 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BLUE HOUR set a well rated pace in the early going, opened a clear advantage in the turn and drew off without being threatened in the lane. CONSTITUTIONALIST broke wide, raced up to be on the early pace, chased the winner through the turn, was no match for that one but finished well as an easy second best. BELLAVALENCIA reserved off the pace down the backside, saved ground on the turn and rallied mildly in the lane to gain the show. MISS LINDYSUE chased the two pacesetters through the turn and kept on down the lane. SOLDAT TEMPTATION unhurried early, rallied eight wide at the top of the stretch and showed some late interest. IMA SURE BET raced near the rear of the field to the quarter pole, split rivals from four wide in upper stretch and improved position down the lane. BEAUTY IN MOTION well placed tracking the pace for a half and flattened out turning for home. ITALIAN TWIN failed to menace. ICEY ANGEL had no impact. ARTUME was not a threat. NOGRATZ was not a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Blue Hour
ENTRY.OWNER: Burnsworth Richard and Ultra Championship Racing LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Ima Sure Bet
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, split rivals upper, improved position

ENTRY.NAME: Constitutionalist
ENTRY.OWNER: Siesta Thoroughbred Racing Rossi Gregg and Toporcer Greg
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, no match, second best

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 6 1M Dirt CR: 79. Claiming Purse 12200. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 125 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 27 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: VAIL OF HONOR unhurried early to be well behind the field, rallied seven wide circling the field in the final bend and closed with a rush to be up in the final strides. BARRELHOUSE stalked the pace to the far turn racing five wide in the clear, rallied to take the lead nearing the quarter pole, maintained the advantage through the lane gamely and was caught in the shadow of the wire. KHOPILOT reserved off the pace to be mid-pack in a clear pocket down the backside, rallied from six wide in the turn and finished well through the lane while working around traffic. HOUSED tracked the leaders down the backside, rallied inside the pace makers in the turn to loom boldly and flattened out in upper stretch. GAMING SOUL went evenly without being a threat. KILLER BEE slow early to be at the rear of the field and passed tired rivals in the stretch. GIZMO'S MISSION sped to the lead in the first turn, opened a clear margin down the backside and gave way when challenged on the bend. WHISKEY SUNRISE prompted the pace for a half mile and came up empty.

ENTRY.NAME: Housed
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked leaders, bid inside turn, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: Vail of Honor
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, circled 7 wide, closed w/rush, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Whiskey Sunrise
ENTRY.OWNER: Vickers Richard T and Pena Yendri J

ENTRY.NAME: Barrelhouse
ENTRY.OWNER: Warren Andrew N and Warren Rania

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 7 1M Dirt CR: 85. Claiming Purse 13000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE JUNE 27. Three Year Olds, 125 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 27 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In We ight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TWO GUNS set the pace while racing well off the fence down the backside, repelled the challenge of the runner-up in mid-stretch and drew clear to the wire. HADDASSAH'S DEVIL prompted the pace through the far turn, ranged up to engage the leader in upper stretch, was unable to go with that one but finished willingly as the evident second best. MY TWO AUNT JOANS stalked the pace into the far turn, rallied up the fence to threaten on the bend and flattened out turning for home. PEACE OF EKATI slow early to be a distant trailer and showed good energy with a belated rally in the stretch. BEYOND MY DREAMS rated in mid-pack throughout and failed to mount a closing rally. RUBINSTEIN settled off the pace to the head of the lane and made a mild bid while encountering traffic down the stretch. NO MORE TALK contended while well placed tracking the leaders and weakened turning for home. SAY HEY KID was not a threat. DEBDURITE chased the leaders early and steadily faded.

ENTRY.NAME: Two Guns
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, off rail, repelled challenge, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: My Two Aunt Joans
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, inside rally, loomed, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: Rubinstein
ENTRY.OWNER: R and P Racing Stables, LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 8 6F Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 14100. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 125 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 27 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WOODYTHEBIDSPOTTER set the pace from the inside, widened the advantage into the turn, repelled the bid of the runner-up in upper stretch and pulled away down the lane. MSHINDI stalked the pace through the turn, rallied four wide to threaten the leader turning for home, was outkicked down the stretch but finished a clear second best. MIGHTY PELE raced well off the pace despite encouragement through the turn, found best stride late and showed belated energy to make late gains. LOCO tracked the leaders through the turn while well place inside, was set to a drive and failed to gain ground coming home. RESVALON bumped outside rival early on causing that one to be squeezed out, dropped back while re-gaining stride to be near the rear and passed tiring rivals down the stretch. WHEN IN ROME went one-paced as a non-threat. YARDMAN squeezed between rivals early away from the gate, stumbled as result of the bumping, nearly falling or unseating rider, dropped out the rear of the field, was gathered up and finished evenly having lost all chance. AKITO bobbled shortly away from the gate, rushed up to prompt the pace for a half and gave way in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Resvalon
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped early, dropped back, passed tiring rivals,

ENTRY.NAME: Yardman
ENTRY.COMMENT: squeezed early, stumbled, lost all chance

ENTRY.NAME: Loco
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked leader, long drive inside, failed to gain

ENTRY.NAME: Mshindi
ENTRY.OWNER: Hart Sr William D and Benain Michael
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, rally 4w, threatened, outkicked, 2d best
